title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 Point

  • 1 - for Wheat: neither country has an absolute advantage, identical outputs ( with the same resource) Cloth: Country B, as it produces more output (with the same resources)
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

  • 1 - for Wheat: neither country has an absolute advantage, identical outputs ( with the same resource) Cloth: Country B, as it produces more output (with the same resources)

The student earns all of the following points:

  • 1 - for Wheat: neither country has an absolute advantage, identical outputs ( with the same resource) Cloth: Country B, as it produces more output (with the same resources)

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
2 Points

  • 1 - for Country A has comparative advantage in wheat; Country B in cloth

  • 1 - for shown opportunity costs; Country A give up 1 cloth for 1 wheat; Country B gives up 3 cloth for 1 wheat; relatively more expensive for Country B to produce wheat
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

  • 1 - for Country A has comparative advantage in wheat; Country B in cloth

  • 1 - for shown opportunity costs; Country A give up 1 cloth for 1 wheat; Country B gives up 3 cloth for 1 wheat; relatively more expensive for Country B to produce wheat

The student earns one of the following points:

  • 1 - for Country A has comparative advantage in wheat; Country B in cloth

  • 1 - for shown opportunity costs; Country A give up 1 cloth for 1 wheat; Country B gives up 3 cloth for 1 wheat; relatively more expensive for Country B to produce wheat

The student earns all of the following points:

  • 1 - for Country A has comparative advantage in wheat; Country B in cloth

  • 1 - for shown opportunity costs; Country A give up 1 cloth for 1 wheat; Country B gives up 3 cloth for 1 wheat; relatively more expensive for Country B to produce wheat

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 Point

  • 1 - for Country B will import wheat because it has comparative advantage in cloth (and will specialize in cloth production, getting its wheat more cheaply via trade) Key point is comparative advantage
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

  • 1 - for Country B will import wheat because it has comparative advantage in cloth (and will specialize in cloth production, getting its wheat more cheaply via trade) Key point is comparative advantage

The student earns all of the following points:

  • 1 - for Country B will import wheat because it has comparative advantage in cloth (and will specialize in cloth production, getting its wheat more cheaply via trade) Key point is comparative advantage

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 Point

  • 1 - for country B, via trade a unit of wheat only costs 2 units of cloth, while by domestic production a unit of wheat would cost 3 units of cloth. Also the student may explain that trade increases B's consumption possibilities by making it possibly to consumer more of both goods
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

  • 1 - for country B, via trade a unit of wheat only costs 2 units of cloth, while by domestic production a unit of wheat would cost 3 units of cloth. Also the student may explain that trade increases B's consumption possibilities by making it possibly to consumer more of both goods

The student earns all of the following points:

  • 1 - for country B, via trade a unit of wheat only costs 2 units of cloth, while by domestic production a unit of wheat would cost 3 units of cloth. Also the student may explain that trade increases B's consumption possibilities by making it possibly to consumer more of both goods
